metadata.title: CVE-2022-26365 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Linux disk/nic frontends data leaks T[his CNA information record relates tomultiple CVEs; the text explains which aspects/vulnerabilities correspondto which CVE.] Linux Block and Network PV device frontends don't zeromemory regions before sharing them with the backend (CVE-2022-26365,CVE-2022-33740). Additionally the granularity of the grant table doesn'tallow sharing less than a 4K page, leading to unrelated data residing inthe same 4K page as data shared with a backend being accessible by suchbackend (CVE-2022-33741, CVE-2022-33742).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-31.31').
linux-aws package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.8').
linux-azure package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1007.7').
linux-gcp package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1007.7').
linux-lowlatency package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-31.31.1').
linux-oracle package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1005.5').
linux-raspi package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1004.4').
xen package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
